Articles.Content: Kerbin trials of my overhead crane are just about complete.

What are the aerospikes for? to lift the entire structure? how many orange tanks have you moved with it? Can we get a closeup of the trolly system?

In other words...

THTS KEWL!

I use the aerospikes to drop the crane anywhere on Kerbin for testing. It makes quick work of moving orange tanks around. I've moved two at a time to date. The ballast tanks on the end of the boom are used as a counter weights. I pump prop into the ballast tank opposite the load to keep the boom level.

Trolly close up coming up...
Here are some close ups of the trolly system. The trollies dock up when the crane is "dropping" to the work site.
WOW. Impressive indeed. Does it have a counterbalance?

WOW. Impressive indeed. Does it have a counterbalance?

Yeah, the tanks on the ends of the top boom are normally empty. As you lift a heavy load, pump fuel into the opposite tank to counterbalance the load.
